name: Fried Yellow Squash
author: Stacy Hogan Gaddy
summary: Here's a fast and simple way to use up your summer squash (also called crooked neck squash). I have also used this recipe for okra and zucchini. My kids gobble up their veggies this way!
ingredients: ¾ cup self-rising cornbread mix (such as Martha White®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup olive oil, or more as needed
directions: Place cornbread mix in a gallon-size resealable bag; season with salt and black pepper
Add squash, seal bag, and shake to coat evenly
Remove squash from bag and shake off any excess cornmeal
Heat about 1/4 inch of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Fry squash in the hot oil, working in batches, until center is cooked and edges are crisp, 2 to 3 minutes per side
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate
